title: Missed Assignment vs 10/11 Grading Pattern
content:
Grading Document -
"The calculation of Final course Score for eligible students is as follows:

GAA1 = Average score in Best 10 objective assignments out of First 11 graded objective assignments
GAA2 = Average score in Best 10 programming assignments out of First 11 graded programming assignments"

But Week 11 is bonus and there’s no assignment, so how is it balanced for people who missed an assignment ?

title: Doubts clarification or clarification on points reduction for graded assignments submitted
content:
My specific doubt is on the topic: clarification on points reduction

My doubt is:
Recently I have submitted my programming graded assignments. In the grading system there are two parts Public Test Case and Private Test Case. As per my understanding the Public Test Case evaluates the given program solution on test run basis and Private Test Case is evaluated based on the actual submission of the assignment. I cannot understand why the Private Test Case results are reduced by one point in some graded assignments which I submitted and the method of evaluation for programming assignments is not mentioned anywhere in the portal or anywhere else. The video on submitting the graded programming assignments also did not clear the above mentioned doubts. Kindly clear my doubt on the above points and help me to understand how the points are reduced and the programming assignments are evaluated.

title: Request for Review of DBMS OPPE Python‑PostgreSQL Issue, Laptop Usage, and Graded Assignment Average
content:
I faced a few issues during the DBMS OPPE and with the final assignment grading that I would like to seek clarification on:

  1. OPPE Python‑PostgreSQL Question:
    While attempting the Python‑PostgreSQL question, I imported all the required libraries and followed the correct syntax. However, during compilation, the query was marked as “invalid syntax,” even though the compiler suggested the keyword while typing. I successfully passed 100/100 test cases in the SQL question just before this, so I’m concerned that this might affect my performance. While it’s possible I made an unintentional mistake, I would be grateful if the logs for my attempt could be reviewed to confirm the issue.

  2. Laptop Restriction During OPPE:
    Due to serious performance issues with my older laptop, I used a newer device to take the exam. However, the exam link didn’t allow access and showed that only the previously registered laptop could be used. Since the exam is already screen- and video-recorded, I was unsure why this restriction applies. I seek clarification on what should be done in cases where the original device becomes too slow or non-functional.

  3. Final Graded Assignment Average:
    I noticed that my final average for the graded assignments is showing as 60%, whereas I received 85% in one assignment which was actually my lowest among all 10. This seems inconsistent, and I kindly request a recheck of the average calculation.

I double-checked my Python‑PostgreSQL code and ensured correct syntax and library usage. I’ve also reviewed the assignment scores and tried comparing them to the final average. Despite this, the issues remain unclear to me, which is why I am posting here for clarification and help from the support team.

10002000991080×2340 245 KB

title: Strange submission times for assignments
content:
Hello @Karthik_POD @jkmadathil

Sir, I have raised this issue in another course and now I bring this up again in Python course. The end time for assignments seem to be very inconsistent. Our weekly assignments have deadline at 11:59 pm. But other assignments have very random deadlines.
There was an assignment in Stats2 which had a deadline at 5:59pm. I suggested to the team that they keep consistent deadlines as we already have too much to deal with. Adding another task of keeping track of deadline timings increases the load esp if someone is working and trying to complete this course.

Most of the time I just look at the date of the assignment and think that I can do it any time on that day. I know I should have been more careful.

Today I noticed and assignment for PYQ from Sep 23 which has a dealine of 5:59 am. This is just so random.
Please stick. to a specific time in when setting the dealine.

title: Doubt in question 9 of graded assignment 7
content:
Screenshot 2025-03-03 at 1.09.40 PM1936×1256 156 KB

In this question, for A = [[1 0 0] [0 1 0] [0 0 1]], Ax = x, Ay = y, Az = z and all x, y, z are eigenvectors of A. This also satisfies A = A^T.

For A = [[1 1 0] [1 1 1] [0 1 1]], Ay = (2, 3, 2) != λy. This also satisfies A = A^T.

So we have matrices A that satisfy and do not satisfy the condition. So the answer should be “Can’t say without knowing the element of A”, but it is given as “No”. Please clarify on this

title: Request for Consideration Regarding Assignment Eligibility Criteria
content:
Dear IITM Team,

I understand that IITM has a strict policy against relaxing assignment eligibility criteria or extending deadlines. However, I would like to respectfully request your consideration regarding my current situation.

I recently became aware that the eligibility criteria changed this term from “Best 5 out of 9” to “Best 5 out of 7,” which significantly impacts my standing. Due to work pressures and personal commitments, I missed submitting yesterday’s assignment, which would have allowed my average to exceed the required 200 points.

Given that this represents a substantial change from previous terms’ requirements that many students were accustomed to, I would like to request either:

1. A one-time extension for submission of yesterday’s assignment, or
2. A temporary modification to “Best 5 out of 8” for this transitional term

Without this consideration, I will unfortunately need to repeat the entire semester. I have attempted to reach the support team multiple times regarding this matter.

I greatly appreciate your time and consideration of my request.

title: Assignment Relaxation
content: I’m totally aware that IITM does not tolerate, assignment relaxation realted to eligibility and does not extend deadlines. However, the eligiblity was changed this term from Best 5 out 9 to Best 5 out of 7, of which i wasn’t totally aware of you. I have missed assignments due to my work pressure and personal commitments, and i’m just late by a day , if i had submitted yesterday’s assignment my avg would have crossed 200. Since there was a drastic change in the rules, and we were accustomed to this, I request the IITM team to give one final extension or take the Best 5 out of 8, allowing people like me who werent aware of the change a chance. Or else i will have to waste a full semester please kindly help, i’ve mailed the support multiple times about the same.

title: Graded Assignment 6 (Part -1) Q3
content:
My specific doubt is on the topic: Combination and Permutation

My doubt is:

image1314×400 24.4 KB

Here, What is “irrespective of direction” means?

Recommended:
Mention what you have done till now to find clarification on the doubt:

As far my understand, “irrespective of direction” means,
The direction of travel doesn’t matter; that is, a ticket from Station A to Station B is considered the same as a ticket from Station B to Station A.

So we need to find the Combination, order doesn’t matter. If we respect the direction then order matters.

Sometimes, I feel the Permutation and Combinations are bit like English riddles. Instead of checking Logical and Reasoning skill, the answers play around the words. So please clearly frame the question, without second interpretation. Its my kind request to the team.
